13111112222111121.content:
It was like watching a movie in a constant loop, over and over again. Every time, you’d perk up when that part came on, that part that really got to you, and silently you’d dread it. You've watched it at least a dozen times now, but it’s like being in a new experience every time just watching it. It’s like time itself freezes, heck everything freezes, leaving you and that image to keep replaying in your head, haunting you every second that it’s on.
You had a similar experience right now, watching, almost witnessing the physical domination of one of your most fierce adversaries, Frostbite. The truth is that you should be glad, rejoicing that she’s finally getting her comeuppance, and the irony of it all, at the hands of her own secret weapon. You should be celebrating, thankful that you weren't in that situation, when really, there was nothing to be thankful for. You were still trapped here with your enemies, your opponents, and now, your tormentors.
You continued to watch as Mighty Mouth her assault on Frostbite, stomping on her head like it was much sticking to her soles. Her attacks were merciless, remorseless, almost devoid of any humanity at all, just comprised on her systematic stomping, her bare sole coming down on the ebony girl’s face over and over again. Even you couldn’t help but cringe in an almost empathetic connection to the Eskimo girl, just watching as the Latina girl punishes her.
Frostbite’s face, once flawless and beautiful, was now a crimson mask, blood seeping out of her mouth like a river, scarring her once beautiful caramel skin. You winced again as Mighty Mouth slammed her heel into Frostbite’s left eye, laughing almost manically as she grinded her foot into the pupil. Frostbite’s screams and whimpering pierced through you like a dagger, it was like the Latina girl had become someone else, something else even.
When you stared at Mighty Mouth, you saw a perverse, almost insane flicker in her eyes as she continued to assault Frostbite, who could barely shield her face. From what you could tell ,she had a broken nose, a black eye, and at the rate she was going, maybe a missing set of teeth.
It was a blessing that Mighty Mouth finally stopped, raising her foot and stomping down with great finality on the face of Frostbite one last time. Her head rolled to the side limply, her eyes staring up at the lights.
To add even more insult of injury, Mighty Mouth planted her foot triumphantly on her throat, pressing down on it with her toes. Frostbite wrapped her fingers around it feebly, trying to wrench it loose. She only stared at the victorious Latina girl with a defeated look on her face, as Mighty Mouth turned around triumphantly around the round, evidently hoping for some applause at her victory.
Instead, when Mighty Mouth looked around, she noticed that a swift silence had overtaken the room. Almost everyone was staring in shock, perhaps in horror at the sheer brutality hidden behind her flirty demeanor. Pyra simply stared in silence, staring at the voluptuous Latina with a certain fire in her eyes. Even the Troop Squad were taken aback by this sudden mean streak of Mighty Mouth, the three looking at the beaten, broken body of Frostbite, pinned almost mockingly under Mighty Mouth’s foot with troubled expressions of their faces. Icicle was staring at her with a downright murderous look in her eyes, her fists shaking in anger. She was fuming, almost incensed at this act of apathy by the promiscuous one.
When Mighty Mouth and the elder Icicle touched eyes, there was a mutual sense of hatred between the two, Icicle clenching her fists and Mighty Mouth flashing her a taunting confident sneer, knowing that she couldn’t stop what was happening.
She licked her lips before looking down on Frostbite.
“You know what Frosty, I get it, I really do. You know, you want to prove yourself, in front of your gals, in front of Hawk Boy over there,” she started, gesturing towards you before turning back to her.
“Even in front of that old, decrepit vulture over there you want to call a aunt, you wanted to prove to everybody here that you were the women of the hour. And maybe you did, but the fact is, you lost this little contest, now time to pay the piper, eh?” she smirked, leaning on her knee as she continued to mock the defeated villain.
Frostbite tried to refuse, but before she could even open her mouth, a fresh batch of blood started to bubble through her lips.
“These stipulations you know, a real bummer. I feel for you girl, I really do, but you know what they say, do the crime, pay the time. You disrespected me Frostbite, now it’s time to pay, and believe me, Mamacita don’t take checks. You’re gonna pay full price for this. And you can start with a downpayment right now by kissing my foot,” she proclaimed proudly, hovering her foot seductively above Frostbite’s lips, the same foot that broke her nose. She wiggled her toes in anticipation, even arching her foot.
Frostbite only stared at her with an almost indignant glow in her eyes, a fire now lit behind her icy statue. For a second there, you could spot a certain ferocity in the ebony girl’s face as she glared at Mighty Mouth, her face still bloodied but her eyes as fierce as ever. You could tell that maybe the Latina bombshell took it too far.
“Come on Frosty, isn't this what you want?” Mighty Mouth purred, almost seductively, as she arched her bare sole over Frostbite’s face, enjoying every second of this humiliation.
Despite this, Frostbite refused to kiss her foot, instead staring at her.
Mighty Mouth placed her hands on her hips and playfully pouted.
“What no kiss? I’m almost disappointed,” she smirked, running her hands through her raven black hair.
She licked her lips hungrily as she pondered what to do next. She glared back at Icicle, who was still fuming at her, her eyes bulging in anger.
“Fine, if you won’t kiss my feet willingly, then I guess I’ll have to make you. Some things just never change, ” she smiled, her eyes glowing dangerously sadistic, as she raised her foot again for another cringe-worthy blow.
“Haven’t you done enough?” Icicle finally spoke, her voice shaking as she attempted to control her anger. Based on the downright murderous look she was giving the Latina beauty, her patience was running thin.
Mighty Mouth instead lowered her foot and gently caressed Frostbite's cheek, her toes scratching at her bruised skin. She smiled as she saw Frostbite instinctively cringe as her toes caressed her face. Finally, she wedged her toes in between her nose, playfully pinching her nose as to keep her in place, before turning back to the elder villain.
“Hold that thought,” Mighty Mouth smiled, her entire sole plastered over Frostbite’s face.
Her neck craned back as she locked eyes with Icicle.
“Believe me, I haven’t even begun to do anything. This, this is just preliminary, you haven’t even seen the main event,” Mighty Mouth smiled, licking her lips sexually with her tongue.
“You won the fight, congratulations! Don’t lose your head,” Icicle snarled.
“Funny, I think that you’d show a heck of a lot more respect for someone who just gave your little niece more action than she’s ever had in her life. Besides, it’s not like you can stop me viejo. From what I’m looking at right now, you can’t even stop Father Time,” Mighty Mouth retaliated.
“Get out before you get put out!” Icicle responded, narrowing her eyes. You noticed that she was starting to reach inside of her pocket for something.
“Says who? You? You couldn’t stop me beating up your own niece even if you were in your prime. If this sorry excuse for a villainess couldn’t beat me, who do you think can?” Mighty Mouth laughed confidently.
Icicle smirked before saying:

And you could do nothing to stop it. It sounded too dark, too inhumane to be real, and for a while, you started to believe it, that it was nothing but a dream. But as soon as you looked down, felt the numbness of your wounds start to wear off, you realized that you could no longer hide yourself from the truth. The truth, that Frostbite and Jester had conquered you.
As your eyes opened, you got a full glimpse at the world around you. From the looks of it, you were in the same soundproof single cell, the setting for your torture at the hands of Frostbite and Icicle. The room was bare, devoid of any color except for a metallic gray covering the walls. You tried to crane your neck around, but quickly found out that the two villainesses hadn't missed a step, to your utter chagrin.
You were strapped to a wooden chair sitting, with snake of ropes coiled around both of your wrists as well as your ankles, keeping you tied there. Your torso was also tied to the chair, making you completely immobile. After struggling against your restraints for the better part of the next minute, you eventually succumbed to the grim reality of it all, the reality that you failed.
Your face was reminiscent of someone who had just been through both world wars, but even that could be an understatement. You face was riddled with various gashes and bruises, broken limbs and deep lacerations. You mouth was still seeping with blood, your lips as crimson as the blood still dripping out of your mouth. You could barely feel your jaw, which might already be broken. Your nose was broken, a squashed tomato at this point.
Every time you took a breath, you cringed, feeling that tooth still lodged into your left nostril, a result of Jester’s last kick into your mouth, her heel just driving itself into your front teeth, knocking one clean out while chipping the others. Your tongue mournfully felt around the empty space where the tooth had just been, a true testament to their collective dominance over you. Both of your eyes were swollen shut, with a nasty bruise on your forehead swelling up so large that it could be your third eye. In essence, you were a beaten, broken man, half of your face still numb from the beating and the other half still throbbing and aching in pain.
Your head was still drooped over, your eyes staring blankly at the floor, and your hair fanning your bloodied face. It was like looking in the mirror of someone who had just been through war and back, not a superhero like yourself.
The last thing you remembered was Frostbite rearing her bare foot back and sending it flying towards your unprotected face, her soft yet deadly sole leaving its mark on your left eye. The next thing you knew, you felt a subtle darkness start to overwhelm you, the pitch black clouding your vision. Your head rolled over to the side, in a humiliating but somewhat fitting way, the last image you saw was Frostbite’s bare foot, her toes pointing directly at you. Everything then faded to black, her raucous, triumphant laugh echoing throughout the cell before you faded to black.
Your left eye was still swollen short, a souvenir from Jester’s boot grinding itself in your face, but you could still make out the single door, your personal salvation. The door was a good twenty feet away, as you would soon realize to your utter chagrin.
As you squirmed against the restrains, you realized that they had thankfully put at least some of your clothes back on, if not to maintain what little dignity you still had left. They had put your pants on, but left your chest bare, which was still decorated with scars and swollen bumps on your mid-section that resemble fractured ribs. To add insult to injury, the two were cruel enough to keep the room below freezing, a temperature suitable for storing frozen meats. You felt yourself involuntarily shivering as the cold bit at your exposed chest, causing your body even more pain as you tried to warm yourself up by moving your chest. Each time you shivered or even sneezed, the pain would continue to throb, making it harder for you to endure these near subzero temperatures.
You winced in pain just turning your head a crack to the left, but managed to endure the excruciating throbbing in your torso to catch something out of the corner of your eye: your gear.
Sure enough, the two had left your utility belt as well as your full body armor in a pile of metal, your belongings being stacked atop one of another, your belt on top. The only downside, it was on the other side of the room. You’d have to somehow free yourself from these ropes, which is near impossible given your current condition and the fact that its freezing cold in the room. Plus, there’s no telling when those she-devils would pop up, probably with another wave of pain and suffering to dish out.
As much as you hated to deny, you couldn’t help but agree with their tactics. They were not only sadistic, but they were also strategic. They not only broke you physically, but mentally. By having your utility belt and gear so close to you, they knew it would drive you to tears, glaring helplessly at your only backup. Plus, they had you purposely face the door, to make you await their arrival with dread and fear. The anticipation of your executioners coming your way would drive a man insane, even you. It was the perfect plan, breaking you mentally in two different ways. Still, you had to keep your morale up, as it was the only thing you had left. You turned back to your gear to ponder more.
Even in the slim, near minuscule chance that you could make it to your gear, you wouldn't last the first round against the two villainesses. You were fatigued, beaten, bruised, almost dead. They would cripple you even without the use of their superpowers, only their hands and feet. You couldn’t beat them, but maybe there were other people who could do the job for you.
For a second there, a glimmer of hope began to re-surface, melting the icy prison which had encompassed your mind. A smile, albeit bloody and nearly toothless, appeared on your face, as you answered your own questions. On the center of your utility belt, Action Girl had built in a silent alarm button for you, for whenever you get in situations like this. It’ll alert both Ninja Girl and Action Girl to your current location, a last resort. But the last time you were in contact with Action Girl, she was tracking down the Troop Squad in the suburbs. But, there was always Ninja Girl.
The glimmer of hope started to fade as soon as you felt the sharp tug of the ropes against you ropes as you leaned towards the belt. It brought you back to reality, as you realized that none of your plans would come to fruition without first escaping your bonds. That itself would require almost Herculean strength, something that you were in short supply of in the present moment.
You tested the tightness of the ropes by trying to flex your arms against it. It was secure, the ropes maintaining its position against your muscles. You tried to move your legs, but to no avail. They were strapped to the legs of the chair, making your mobility very limited. The rope only clawed back at your ankles.
Still, that didn’t stop you from trying. For the next minute or so, you struggled against the restraints, maneuvering your body left and right. You felt the ropes resist your struggles over and over again, the fibers starting to etch itself into your bare skin. Finally, you eventually succumbed to your confines, and decided to conserve your energy.
You took a deep breath, trying to recompose yourself and better map out your “escape” plan. You had one of two options: Option A, wait until Frostbite and Jester come back for you and wait for an opening before making a run for it, or Option B, make a beeline for your stuff. Both options were near equal in their repercussions, another beating that you surely won’t be able to wake up from.
Option A was a gamble to say the least. You barely had enough strength to nod your head up and down, much less overpower the two fatales and escape. They would cripple you before you even left the room, so the chances of that succeeding was minimal, if not downright microscopic.
Option B had a slightly better chance of success, but even that was a stretch. You’d have to somehow free yourself, make it over to your gear, and call in for backup before they came back. The room for error had to be minimal if not entirely nonexistent, if you still valued your life, or what was left of it.
Regardless, you didn’t have time to further to weigh your options, as a familiar sound broke your train of thought.
The sound of footsteps clattering against the floor like a pack of frenzied wolves echoing throughout the night, alerting you to their presence.
You cursed madly as the footsteps drew nearer, reminding you of the terror that was coming your way. From the sound of their collective voices, they were laughing about something.
Reluctantly, you tried to listen in to their conversation.
“You think any of the bird brain's friends will come looking for his dead carcass?” came Frostbite’s sneering voice.
“I doubt it. Frankly, else than his two little lady friends, I doubt anyone will miss the little perv,” Jester agreed, her voice just as sadistic.
Fear began to sweep through your body. You knew what they were capable of, what they are capable of. The risk of just sitting there to await your inevitable demise was too much, too nerve wracking. You had to do something, and do it now!
What will you do?

Finally, you managed to find cover in the form of a large air conditioning unit, which was strategically a few feet to your left. You slumped against the metallic machine as the gunfire continued, preventing any means of escape or even a counterattack.
Your body inhaled and exhaled like a paper bag, your heart beating a mile a minute. Peer exhilaration had filled your lungs, raw adrenaline pumping through your veins. You could barely feel your pulse on one wrist, you were breathing that hard.

“She really is a ninja,” you thought, before the hail of bullets started to chip away at the conditioning unit, breaking up your train of thought. You instinctively covered your head as the gunfire continued, banging against the metal next to you.
Seconds later, you heard a loud click, a sound you knew all too well.
“Out of ammo,” you mouthed out, as you heard a loud curse emitting from the assailant. You slumped back against the unit, taking advantage of this momentary ceasefire.
Feeling the cold sweat drip down from your forehead, you reached out to wipe some of the sweat from your brow, before it hit you.

Instantly, a wave of fear swept across your body, rendering most of your joints numb and unnerving. You dreaded this moment, when she would come after you, when she would find you, when she would kill you.
Madam Reich.
That very name struck an unprecedented chord within Footropolis, as well as the criminal underworld. A self-proclaimed Nazi supremacist, Reich was a cruel, sadistic woman who could’ve had tea with Hitler anyday. Her methods were crude yet destructive, her methods morally ambiguous and crude. She thrived in the pain and suffering of others, that being the focal point of most of her hate crimes. Assassinations, car bombs, arson, you name it. She did it.
The last time you saw her was last week, when she tried to assassinate the Mayor atop the Foyers administrative building. If you had bee a second slower, that one bullet would’ve thrown the into city into turmoil and civil unrest. But thankfully, you were able to push the gun, derailing the course of the bullet so it would miss by a centimeter. A centimeter, that was how close you were to failing, how close the city was to meeting an early armageddon. She got away, but she sent a message that day.
Flashes of her previous crimes that you foiled come to mind, most of them close calls even for you. She was dangerous, armed to the teeth, and always one step ahead. The last time you underestimated her, she almost put a bullet through your skull.
As much as you hated to admit it, you couldn't deny that she was an excellent opportunist. She took advantage of situations, at your expense anyways. From the direction that her voice emitted from, she was on the other side of the rooftop, probably entering from the rooftop door. Ah, what honor that will bring me Hawk Boy, by taking you out, as well as the girl,” she cackled insanely, her voice a high-pitched giggle.
You groaned as she began to digress in one of her profound tirades, her voice starting to trail off.
Reaching into your utility belt, you quickly drew a circular disk, sharp enough to disarm her. Even if you couldn’t nail it, you could at least create a momentary distraction. Reich will shoot anything that moves. Praying silently, you started to position yourself as she continued to talk.
“I will drain your blood into the fountains Hawk Boy, and hover your head above City Hall so all the Americans can see what has become of their hero, and what will become of them if they continue to resist my movement. Don’t think I've forgotten about the girl either, no I will have something special for her,” she continued.
“In fact, not only will I expose her for the fraud she is, but I’ll-,” she started, but you cut her off mid-sentence.
With a cry, you summoned every ounce of courage you still had left and hurled the disk at her, throwing it as precise as you could towards the direction of her voice.
Not waiting to see if it connected or not, you quickly burst into action, leaping out of cover and running towards the mask.
You could hear a single shot burst from her gun, probably to dispose of the weapon. You had to admit that her aim was near impeccable, as she was easily able to drop the weapon with one bullet in less than 10 seconds. But that was all the time you needed.
Throwing yourself to the ground, you grabbed the mask en route to another air conditioning unit before Reich finally got on.
The mask now in your possession, you slid behind another air conditioning unit as she opened fire, no doubt enraged that she was deceived.
“American Abschaum!” she bellowed, infuriated.
“You think your toys will defeat me boy? They have only prolonged the inevitable my friend, and the inevitable shall be pain and suffering for you,” she fumed.
From the sound of her footsteps, you could tell that she was starting to approach your location. You heard a reloading sound after she finished unloading her magazine at the unit.
“First, I will cripple you like an old man. Then, I will castrate you like a common dog. Then, I will puncture each artery, every organ, until you bleed out. Then, I’ll force you to watch as I do the same to your little girlfriend!” she hissed, clearly trying to force you to act on emotion, a death trap.
“Then, I’ll put a bullet in her pretty little head, and make you watch. And as you lay there, helpless to stop it, I will sit back and watch as you die slow, painful, knowing that this is all your doing. Why, I might even let you keep the mask on. Seems more fitting that way, wouldn't you say?” she sneered, getting closer and closer towards you.
“Make it easy on yourself Hawk Boy. Face me like a man, or die like a little boy,” she continued, her footsteps now yards away.
She playfully emptied the rest of her round into the air, before throwing the gun aside.
From your peripheral vision, you could barely make out her drawing a pistol from her belt, a gun with a more controlled rate of fire.
You had to do something, and you had to do it now.
Taking a deep breath, you quickly drew another disk, ready for the inevitable.
